name: Regal Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Arriving in Hong Kong after a long crowded and cramped flight from the UK it was great to walk a short distance to this hotel, all under cover. The female receptionist was efficient but lacked any warmth. The concierge's staff (Johnny and Leon) were helpful and gave good advice about how to get places. The bedroom had two double beds (I was travelling alone) so plenty of space to spread out. The bedroom and bathroom were clean though I felt the inside of the bath could have benefited from an extra scrub! Also I found a drawerful of coins from a previous guest so housekeeping could be improved. Tea and coffee making facilities, an iron and board, in-room safe, hairdryer, slippers and bathrobes contributed to a pleasant stay. Very minimal noise from the airport and the view from my window was across the end of the runway to the sea. I ate in the airport where food is apparently cheaper than the hotel. Check out was at 12 noon but as my flight was not until the evening I was able to store my luggage with the concierge at no cost, and take the free shuttle bus to a nearby mall. From there I took the cable car up to the giant buddha - quite an amazing trip and a good way to spend the afternoon. There are nice spa and pool facilities at the hotel (the former quite expensive, I thought) but I was not in a mindset for them. I would use this hotel again for a one night stopover for the sheer convenience.
reviews.title: Very convenient and comfortable

reviews.text: Rooms are quiet, no aircraft noise. swimming poll nice. Walking distance from the terminal. Food is okay, Well connected by bus. 35 min ride by express train to city, ticket 100 HK dollars.But the staff at coffee shop are very rude
reviews.title: Poor interaction with staff, coffee shop staff rude

reviews.text: Airport terminal is a short walk from check-out desk. The Hotel is not luxuriant but it is definitely comfortable enough. The pool & spa areas are nice and even on a rainy day you can go for a swim. Concierge Johnny and all the others are so accomidating it makes up for what the hotel lacks in ambiance. The souvenir shops are 'cents' above alley prices. Bus stops right in front of the hotel and the train is just minutes away.
reviews.title: Hong Kongvenient!

reviews.text: I have never much liked this hotel, and my most recent stay did not change my mind. The decor is Moscow discotheque circa 1980, the staff are uninterested at best, and there is no attempt to hide the fact that the majority of guests are stuck there because their flight got cancelled. Admittedly, the hotel's location just a few hundred metres from the main Hong Kong airport terminal (access via a covered walkway) is extremely convenient, but that's where the attraction ends. When you have to work so little to get customers, it shows. I only booked a day-room because I had a twelve-hour lay-over between flights. Honestly, just hang out at Starbucks for the day and save yourself some money.
reviews.title: Only in an emergency
Good airport hotel
reviews.text: Hotel very convenient to airport and only 5 minutes walk to terminal. Staff very friendly and efficient, room compact but tidy but totally adequate for transit purposes. Got a very good price online so overall very good value for money.

Unfortunately I missed my connection to Sydney, so Dragonair put me up in this hotel. I was thinking the worst, but was pleasantly surprised with it as an airport hotel. Yes, it could be so much better. But having said that I've stayed in some pretty ordinary airport hotels in my time. This is not much better than average, but if you have to have a layover at the airport, it isn't that bad. Having said this, if you are going through hong kong, it is only 25 mins to the city on the express, and you are in the heart of it.
reviews.title: Stuck here due to flight delay, reasonably ok...

reviews.text: My stay was unplanned due to a flight cancellation but I have to say, for an airport hotel, the Regal was the pits. The property location adjacent to the airport is fantastic especially with luggage and/or a late evening arrival. My check in was slow and poorly organized even at 0200 in the morning and few people around. The room was 3 star motel at best with a noisy air conditioner and sounds of running water throughout the night. The bed was like sleeping on a fold out sofa bed (with the metal frame digging in with each turn). No mini bar (without a deposit being paid - this would have been great to learn about prior to leaving reception) and room service required cash to be paid on delivery(?). The staff member delivering my order lacked any interest in my concerns and merely shrugged his shoulders.
reviews.title: Convenient...that's about it!

reviews.text: The final straw was no hot water for a shower after a ten hour flight. Bathrooms look like a good clean was needed and the supply of face washers.
reviews.title: Abuse of monopoly

reviews.text: Most of the issues could have been addressed with great customer service, which was unfortunately lacking.
reviews.title: Decent rooms in a great location, but what's with the Classic Reward Card?

reviews.text: Regrettably, the Regal won't be on my list of preferred hotels for my next stay in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Just-about-average airport hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is convenient to the airport terminal. I have stayed here dozens of times: Sometimes it is more tolerable than others. The plumbing is getting older--and some rooms have disturbing noise levels from it. It seems they have some sort of "closed system" for their toilet waste water--and some bathrooms smell quite badly--as though they are overdue for treatment.
reviews.title: Short visits only
Handy overnight hotel
reviews.text: It is a "transient hotel"--and prone to having tour groups trying to check-in at all hours of the day and night. Seems many Chinese cannot read room numbers--and often you will awaken to the sound of some hapless traveler trying his key in your door. Very annoying and ongoing.
Their breakfast buffet used to be quite decent--but the selection has diminished and I often skip it--even though it is included. Of better quality--but quite pricey--are room service selections.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: Some rooms' climate control is ineffective: It can become too cold or quite humid. It is not uncommon to return to the front desk and request a room change for such reasons.
reviews.title: Very good airport hotel

reviews.text: My company forces me to stay at Regal--so I try to make the most of it--but there are better options (Marriott & Novotel) within 10 minutes of the airport--with courtesy transportation--either of which would be my clear preference to this airport Regal.
reviews.title: Very Handy Transit Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed overnight to breakup our longhaul flights & stay close to the airport. Front counter staff were not welcoming and service was very slow. Another man standing in the regal rewards line just gave up and walked away.
reviews.title: Transit Stop

reviews.text: Room was ok with a small divan & 1 chair. Bed very firm but pillows good. Pool & spa areas are clean, however the decking around the indoor pool is slippery. Staff at the pool counter were friendly and even gave me a smile when I brought back my locker key.
reviews.title: airport regal hotel

reviews.text: this is a good hotel, step of the plane and virtually walk into it. large hotel but rather costly £180 per night , plenty of ammenities inside for all and not noisey being next to airport rooms lavish good staff all round and out of the door china on your doorstep, transport to kalwoon or hongkong on doorstep about 25 minutes ,travel time, you can get place cheaper if you book well in advance and spend more nights there. if meals dear you can go into airport concourse and eat there very reasonable outlets.
reviews.title: Good for a stopover

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for one night in August on our way back to the UK. We arrived in the evening and left early in the morning so didn't use any of the hotel's facilities but it was perfect for the one night as it was only a few minutes walk from the airport via a walkway.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, Mediocre Everything Else

reviews.text: Our rooms were nice with everything we needed, however late at night there was a horrible smell coming from our airconditioning unit. This only lasted about an hour so we didn't report it and didn't want to change rooms at midnight.
reviews.title: Many Visits

description: Directly connected to the passenger terminal of Hong Kong International Airport by an enclosed, air-conditioned link bridge. The multi-award wining Regal Airport Hotel Hong Kong provides superb and comfortable accommodations with 1,171 guest rooms, state-of-the-art meeting and conference facilities including Hong Kong's largest pillarless hotel grand ballroom and 30 function venues, authentic cuisines with 6 restaurants and bars, and a complete range of recreational facilities featuring a luxurious spa with extensive massage menu, as well as an outdoor pool and an indoor heated swimming pool.
